page.title: 05Development Board
page.content: The Development Board for Rural Wales, established in 1977 in its present form has made a major contribution to help to place Newtown on the map.The population of the town already exceeds 8,000 and it is anticipated that by the next decade its population will exceed 11,000. The Headquarters of the Board is at Ladywell House,and the Board has modernised shops & offices, established factories where people can be employed built modern housing estates and recreational facilities for the inhabitants.One of the Board's aims is to encourage industrialists to move into Newtown by offering them a factory,financial aid & advice.1,925 people are employed in 116 factories built by the Board.The Board is constructing the St.Giles Science Park.The factories on this site will cater for new High Tech industries.
